intro: Unona desmos, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water, and its roots are deep, allowing it to access groundwater. Unona desmos is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh, dry environments. It plays an important role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and small mammals.
